stem: A client at 34 weeks gestation reports a severe headache and 'spots' in her vision. Her blood pressure is 162/110 mmHg and she has 3+ proteinuria. Complete the clinical bowtie.

actions.text: Encourage the client to walk for exercise
Perform a sterile vaginal exam every hour

rationale.correct: Preeclampsia is rooted in placental factors (c1, c2). Actions are focused on seizure prevention (Magnesium, a1) and BP control (Hydralazine, a2). Monitoring DTRs (p1) and UO (p2) is mandatory to detect magnesium toxicity.
rationale.incorrect: Sodium intake (c3) isn't the primary cause. Vaginal exams (a3) are not indicated unless in active labor. Bedrest is preferred over walking (a4).

clinicalPearls: The antidote for magnesium sulfate is calcium gluconate.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: Unlike chronic hypertension, preeclampsia is placental, not dietary. Restricting salt is not the priority treatment.

mnemonic.title: PWSF
mnemonic.expansion:
P = Preeclampsia
W = with
S = Severe
F = Features

Key Actions: Administer magnesium sulfate IV; Administer IV hydralazine or labetalol
Key Monitoring: Deep tendon reflexes (DTRs); Urine output

reviewUnits.heading: Preeclampsia
reviewUnits.body: Preeclampsia is a multi-systemic disorder of pregnancy.
